author: hwright
msg: Abstract out the insertion of the base_nodes as part of wc-ng.
(statements): Update statement to include a new field.
(insert_base_node): Completely rewrite, as just a function which inserts or
replaces a given base node into the database.
(write_entry): Start to reason about when to create various node rows.

author: gstein
msg: Remove all handling for wc_entry.prop_time. It is not persisted into
.svn/entries, so it will always be zero. Nothing attempts to change the
value *away* from zero, so we can simply remove all prop_time code.
Also trimmed out some code that attempted to read changelist and file
external stuff from XML files (old entries and logs). We modify both
synchronously (rather than via loggy), and they are newer features than
(svn_info_t): note that prop_time will always be zero.
(load_props): simplify; we don't have to check for a missing file again.
(svn_wc_props_modified_p): forget the subpool. remove all the
optimizations since this section of code only fires for OLD formats
(revert_admin_things): no need to specify "which" timestamp to update in
(introduce_propcaching): no need to zero out prop_time since, by this
point, the new entries format is used, and has a zeroed time already.
timestamp to update in the svn_wc__loggy_set_entry_timestamp_from_wc
(svn_wc__timestamps_equal_p): no need for a TIMESTAMP_KIND param, as
there is only one kind of timestamp now. simplify function body.
(svn_wc__atts_to_entry): don't bother looking for a PROP_TIME attr since
anything in it (an old log, for example) will end up getting ignored
anyways. also, don't bother looking for CHANGELIST or FILE_EXTERNAL
attributes since they are not in old XML entries files, nor in logs
(log_do_modify_entry): don't worry about prop_time. update an obsolete
just hard-code it to the one kind.
(): update a comment referring to prop_time

author: hwright
msg: Bring up-to-date with trunk.  (to get the skel changes)

author: hwright
msg: Move property list skel parsing and unparsing to libsvn_subr.
